main event: A witness observed a large, brightly lighted object in the sky near the Landers Observatory in California on June 9, 1967.
interesting points: The object was described as very large and brightly lighted, first seen high in the sky southeast of the observatory., The sighting lasted about 5 minutes before the object disappeared from view., The witness noted that the observatory dome was illuminated, which may have influenced their perception of the object's proximity., An investigation suggested that the object was likely a high altitude research balloon., The observatory was undergoing repairs at the time of the sighting, adding context to the reported phenomena.
witness description: Ralph Landers observed the object from near the Landers Observatory.
